DOC.HEADLINE: BRIEFLY : TECHNOLOGY
DOC.TEXT: IBM May Delay Introduction of PowerPC Computer : International Business Machines Corp . may delay introduction of the computers until early 1995 to coincide with the release of a new version of OS / 2 , the operating system software necessary to control the basic functions of the computers , a source close to the company said . A version of OS / 2 geared toward IBM ' s PowerPC-based PCs isn ' t scheduled to be released until the middle of next year.Armonk , N.Y.-based IBM previously had said it would introduce the computers by the end of the year . A spokeswoman would n ' t say when the machines would be released . PowerPC News , a newsletter distributed through the Internet , reported that the three PowerPC-based machines would be delayed until February .
